title: Josiah’s Reforms and Death
summary: Josiah carries out sweeping religious reforms, destroying idols, altars, and shrines throughout Judah and even Samaria. He renews the covenant with God. Sadly, he later dies in battle against Pharaoh Necho.

faq.question: What were some of Josiah’s reforms?
faq.answer: He destroyed pagan worship sites, removed idol priests, and reinstated the Passover.

faq.question: How did Josiah die?
faq.answer: He was killed in battle at Megiddo against Pharaoh Necho of Egypt.
